newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Albania's Berisha to quit if loses election-Dutch.
newsitem.headline: Albania's Berisha to quit if loses election-Dutch.

text.p: Albania's President Sali Berisha told the Dutch ambassador in Tirana on Sunday that he would stand down if his party lost forthcoming elections, Dutch Foreign Minister Hans van Mierlo told reporters in the Netherlands.

"This morning, he (Berisha) made a statement to the Dutch ambassador to the effect that if his party loses the upcoming elections, he would also stand down," van Mierlo told a news conference at the end of a two-day meeting of EU foreign ministers in the Dutch countryside.
Berisha is blamed by many in his country for the collapse of pyramid investment funds that bankrupted thousands and prompted widespread unrest.
In what was seen as a conciliatory gesture, the president last week bowed to opposition demands for an all-party government and fresh elections expected to be held this summer.
